abstract: Financial Accounting Standards board issues rule altering how companies account for most of their leases; rule say most common lease must be on company balance sheets; change has roots in Enron accounting scandal.

headline.print_headline: Accounting Rule With Roots in Enron Scandal Is Issued
headline.main: Post-Enron Accounting Rule Requires Companies to Report Leases

snippet: Starting in 2019, the most common type of lease must be included on a company’s balance sheet, giving investors a more accurate picture of its health.
lead_paragraph: Starting in 2019, the most common type of lease must be included on a company’s balance sheet, giving investors a more accurate picture of its health.
